  <section>
  
> **Examples**

### Reading data into R
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
#Reading in data downloaded onto your local drive
#This code will not work unless you place the comma separated file within the same folder as this about.rmd is in
data <- read.csv("Basketball Analytics/playoffs.csv")
head(data)
```
<hr>

### Looking at the structure of our data set
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
dim(data)
colnames(data)

#Replace Column names with easier keys
colnames(data) <- c("Rank", "Team", "G", "MP", "FG", "FGA", "FGPCT", 
                    "3PM","3PA", "3PPCT","2PM", "2PA", "2PPCT", "FT", 
                    "FTA", "FTPCT", "ORB", "DRB", "TRB", "AST", "STL", 
                    "BLK", "TOV", "PF", "PTS", "Year", "Playoff")
colnames(data)
```
<hr>

### Using `dplyr` to transform the data
##### These functions listed below are the main verbs used out of dplyr

  * [`select`](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/reference/select.html) --
    pick variables by their names
  * [`filter`](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/reference/filter.html) --
    choose rows that satisfy some criteria
  * [`mutate`](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/reference/mutate.html) --
    create transformed or derived variables

#### Selecting certain columns of the data set
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
shooting_data <- select(data, Team, G, MP, FG, FGA, FGPCT, 
                        "3PM","3PA", "3PPCT", "2PM", "2PA", "2PPCT", FT,
                        FTA, FTPCT, PTS, Year, Playoff)
head(shooting_data)

hustle_data <- select(data, -FG, -FGA, -FGPCT, -"3PM", -"3PA", -"3PPCT",
                      -"2PM", -"2PA", -"2PPCT", -FT, -FTA, -"FTPCT",
                      -PTS)
head(hustle_data)
```
<hr>

#### Filtering out values that do not meet a threshold
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
#Filtering the data to work with years starting in the 2000s
new_data <- filter(data, Year >= 2000)
head(new_data)

#Working with the teams' data that made the playoffs that year
playoff_data <- filter(data, Playoff == 1)
head(playoff_data)
```
<hr>

#### Mutate columns together or use mathematical operations to create a new variable
```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
EFGPCT_data <- mutate(data, "EFGPCT" = round(((data[[11]] + (1.5*data[[8]]))/(data[[6]])), digits = 3)*100)
head(EFGPCT_data[,c(2,7,28)])

a_to_ratio <- mutate(data, "Assist/Turnover" = ifelse(TOV == 0, AST, round(AST/TOV, digits = 2)))
head(a_to_ratio[,c(2,20,23,28)])
```
